intro: Haplophyllum bornmuelleri, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Haplophyllum bornmuelleri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging garden conditions.
